item.title: TokHaar-Kal Help
item.dc:creator: @harusakura1 harusakura1
item.description:
@harusakura1 wrote:

I have the same problem, except the inventory thingy. My cape is visible through the player too What can i do to fix it?
I don’t need spoon feed, just some clue, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: TokHaar-Kal Help
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Priorities for the rendering part. Server sided for the inventory slot. For the item’s appearance in the inventory/equipment you either didn’t add the model or used the incorrect model id.

[quote=“poopler40, post:3, topic:442445”][quote author=bibbobbib link=topic=545075.msg3995778#msg3995778 date=1337236990]
Wrong section
[/quote]
How about answering the question then telling him the right section to post it next time. Your not helping.
By the looks of it im thinking that its the capes model itself. Its PRI are wrong. For the inventory view, i think you messed up on the ints models ids you used.[/quote]
^^^^^ couldn’t stress that enough.

Read full topic

item.title: TokHaar-Kal Help
item.dc:creator: @bibbobbib bibbobbib
item.description:
@bibbobbib wrote:

No idea where this is but there should be somewhere saying
isStackable = true
Or something like that if I remember correctly
Change it to false

item.title: TokHaar-Kal Help
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

then you are using the wrong model id in the ints for the inventory part. pm me and ill help you fix the cape.

Read full topic

For the inventory view, i think you messed up on the ints models ids you used.[/quote] Alright, I tried some other ints but the inventory view is still the torva platebody with the tokhaar-kal cape behind it. Also, i’m new at modeling so I don’t know what PRI is. Sorry for posting in wrong section

item.title: TokHaar-Kal Help
item.dc:creator: @doritos_own doritos own
item.description:
@doritos_own wrote:

[center][size=36pt]Well Title Explains it All…[/size][/center]
[center]

14njxuc.jpg1500×528
[/center]
[size=12pt][center]Nevermind the picture to the right i figured it out, but the one on the left still stumps me[/center][/size]

[center][size=18pt]This is my code for the custom ints in itemdef.java[/size][/center]
[center][code] case 13359:
itemDef.modelid = 62697;
itemDef.name = “TokHaar-Kal”;
itemDef.modelZoom = 2086;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 533;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 333;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = -4;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
itemDef.anInt165 = 62575;
itemDef.anInt200 = 62582;
itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
itemDef.groundActions[2] = “Take”;
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”;
itemDef.itemActions[4] = “Drop”;
break;

}[/code][/center]

[center][size=24pt]Additional Info[/size][/center]

[center]Link To Tutorial I Followed - http://www.ru nelocus.com/forums/showthread.php?47135-PI-How-to-add-Customs (Remove the space)[/center]

[center]Link To Models I Used - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,537945.msg3934429.html#msg3934429[/center]

Read full topic
